Software Is Like Sex, It's Better When It's Free

#110436 - cracker - Tue Nov 28, 2006 5:11 pm

I understand your frustration with losing a save in an RPG. But DipStar is very stable when the Mastercode is correct. I'm not sure if this is the situation for FF3 but RPGs are notorious for having saves get messed up when cheat codes are on. And since the codes work fine and the game doesn't crash it is doubtful that the Mastercode is wrong. Did you heed the warning to turn off DipStar before you saved? Doesn't look like you even used the code from what you listed. ;) I suggest that if you are going to use DipStar again on FF3 that you should either disable it before saving and/or only use it until the first save so you have a game save with max money, etc which should carry you through the game fine enough.

#110438 - GNU_Raziel - Tue Nov 28, 2006 5:41 pm

Of course I used codes on a non begining game, if you try on FF3 the game crash after the crystal talk to you on G6 device.

The fact is the gamesave is just empty after I save if Dipstar is loaded, even if a force "no code" by pressing the R trigger or simply load an "empty" dipstar file...

I saw same problem on many gmes with dipstar :
-Children of mana (US)
-Spyro-The new begining (EU)
-Viewtiful Joe-Double Trouble (EU)
-Lunar Genesis (EU)
ect...

Always the SAME problem, with or without code (but with dipstar loaded), the savegame is "flushed"...Perhaps a G6 problem with Dipstar...

I still think Dipstar is a great homebrew but I personnally experienced too much problem with it to consider it as "stable", it's just my opinion of course.

I will wait for the next release and hope the problem i saw is solved :)

BTW I work on some mastercodes now (with ndsdis2 since ndsmas nealy always give me non working ones, not whites screens but just non working) and i hope being able to comeup with some new codes quickly :)

#110448 - cracker - Tue Nov 28, 2006 6:10 pm

The Mastercodes for the DipStar aren't the best ones possible while the AR can probably use many different types of Mastercodes so it has an advantage. If better Mastercodes were found for those games then more than likely the problems would disappear. Mastercodes can appear to be working fine but DipStar might get corrupted only in specific spots in the game. It's trial and error and it can be a pain in the ass since we aren't pros. :)

#110934 - GNU_Raziel - Sun Dec 03, 2006 1:11 am

You must use the "d?sactivation code" BEFORE saving in FF3 or the game consider your save corrupted due to Dipstar's use :
Code:

Disable Dipstar (L+R before save)
E4000130 100000FF
2202F060 E12FFF1E

This code turn off Dipstar until you reboot the NDS, so save ONLy if you intend to stop a moment, or tou will be forced to reload the game after avery save :)

BTW, if you use G6 i got problem i explain before (check page 56) with dipstar's use on many games, even this a proper desactivation code...Perhaps you got the same problem...

#110945 - cracker - Sun Dec 03, 2006 3:14 am

I forgot who asked for a code for Yoshi's Island to have infinite 'Mario Time' but this should work in order to find the address... (I would do it myself but m3dip breaks the game.)

C1000000 100000FF
520ECF40 00043000

Press L+R and it should save the address to the SRAM. Then take the save file and open it in a hex editor and go to 0x3000 and the address will be stored backwards (DD CC BB AA). Then add 8 to the address and that should be where it is stored and try the code: 0aaaaaaa 0000001E. Have fun!

#110946 - nolberto83 - Sun Dec 03, 2006 3:39 am

_________________
Software Is Like Sex, It's Better When It's Free

#110985 - nolberto83 - Sun Dec 03, 2006 11:56 am

Quote:
Thx a lot :)

I would like to know how to find it myself but I simply don't understand ASM and explanations given by czw, too hard for me it seem, or pehhaps I'm just too stupid ^^


First you drop the rom in desmune or ideas and open haste ds. Go where it says snap desmune or ideas then go to where it says DUMP. Save the file as .bin extension. After this put this on the command prompt
ndsdis2 -NH9 [2000000] anyname.bin > anyname.txt

It should give you a 43mb unencrypted disassemble file. Now you just search for 04000130 until you find the bx r14. The reason you can't find the mastercode before is because all nintendo branded games use compression so you can't find the mastercode with ndsmas.

#110991 - GNU_Raziel - Sun Dec 03, 2006 12:52 pm

oh so the dump option in HasteDS uncompress too, cool :)

I tried directly with ndsdis2 but with the compression it doesn't work, now i know how to do it ^^

Thx for the tips :)
_________________
Software Is Like Sex, It's Better When It's Free

#111073 - nolberto83 - Sun Dec 03, 2006 11:03 pm

Quote:
0003E080 E3C0100F bic r1,r0,#0xF

something's wrong here?


In the Euro game i searched for 4000130 I got three results. When I tested all 3 none of them gave me anything. There's a bx r14 at 3a080.
Then I added 4000 to that and it worked.

The US game has a bx r14 at 38df0. Then reason i added 4000 for each game was because the disassemble file doesn't have a header giving you the wrong address. If the game was umcompressed then ypu would see the disassemble file begin at 02004000. Then you get 3cdf0 and 3e080.

#111080 - shark2003 - Mon Dec 04, 2006 12:17 am

shark2003 wrote:

#111557 - cracker - Thu Dec 07, 2006 6:11 pm

What that code is doing is make sure the current health is always the same as the max health. Maybe the game gets messed up if the current health > max health? An easy way to solve this is just to put on the code for max health along with infinite health.

I certain I use 3.33 version and yes, i've pressed Start during the game, many times...

BTW, Dipstar seems to have many problems with G6, it corrupt saves EACH time I used it, even "flush" it sometimes, no matter the version...

With Portrait of ruin (US) it append, when i load the game with dipstar it corrupt the save at loading (the game erase the save at the begining)...

G6 seems to be less "polished" version of M3-perfect...It's the same people but they prefer M3 (more "popular")...Just check the G6 manager and the M3 manager...Same in appearance but different when you check options aviable and possibilities.

If someone else with a G6flash Version 3 can test codes and report it, we will be fixed :)

I forgot to mention mine is a beta version, I own one when I was tester of a NDS fansite (thx to Danny of the G6Team)


I have a g6 lite with Udisk manager 4.6a. What manager version are you using?

#111678 - gardevor - Fri Dec 08, 2006 11:16 pm

C0000000 023B0000 seems to work with no glitches so far, but I'm not sure if the game will freeze or not when you fight Richter to unlock the power of the Vampire Killer later in the game...if it freeze then just change the C code to 020C9420 when you fight him...
If using Mastercode F200453C, enter and exit the Menu to activate the codes (press START twice in game)...

#111694 - GNU_Raziel - Sat Dec 09, 2006 1:06 am

nolberto83 wrote: I have a g6 lite with Udisk manager 4.6a. What manager version are you using?
I use 4.6C version of the manager and Firmware.

I suspect the manager (and/or the firmware) to have some bugs because it seems some games have the "flush save" problem, even without any use of dipstar...Like FF3...let me explain :
-As long as I do not power off the NDS more than 5min, the save is fine...
-If I unplug the G6 to connec it on my PC, saves are flushed (with "problematic" games only, a game like Super Princess Peach do not suffer this problem for exemple)
-If I load a game with Dipstar, saves are corrupted and flushed next time I load it no matter what I try (even with a proper "desactivation code" used before save)

All that is pretty annoying but I do not have other compatible devices to try (Only a SuperCard CF - If I use a working save of the SC/any on the G6, it reject the save and flush it before any possible load exept for combat games like JUS or DBZ)

Many problem so far but that's the life as long as my DS cards still work I'm fine, but I sure will be pleased if all those problems could be solves :)

#111760 - tepples - Sat Dec 09, 2006 9:57 pm

I know how Nintendo can defeat DipStar and ARDS in future DS games. Address space layout randomization is possible with platforms such as the DS that use block devices for storage, but not with platforms such as the GBA that use word-addressed storage.

#111796 - gardevor - Sun Dec 10, 2006 8:20 am

Castlevania :POR (U)

Just as suspected,
C0000000 023B0000
F2001AE8 E12FFF1E
won't work when you fight Richter

and
C0000000 23DF0000
F200453C E12FFF1E
gives blank screens when SAVED and continue on certain point of the Game....? even with only using those 2 lines

both problem lies in the C code

although, C0000000 020C9420 works throughout the whole game, but it's kinda annoying cuz of the minor graphic glitches.. which makes it un-perfect.

someone find a better C code!

btw, the Moon Jump is kinda kool...but, don't abuse it.
ex. When fighting Death the 1st time, you're suppose to enter the door from the right, but, if you use Moon Jump to fly up the Elevator and enter the door from the Left and defeated Death, you'll get stuck in the room when you enter from the right, the next time.

Play as the Secret Characters in Story Mode
12111F52 00000001 (2 Sisters)

12111F52 00000000 (Jonathan and Charlotte = Normal Game)

#112895 - gardevor - Thu Dec 21, 2006 7:26 am

http://blog.goo.ne.jp/imaha486/
Added some ARDS functions
DipStar Ver.061221

とりあえずARDSモード実装。
コード先頭行に FFFFFFFF 00000001 で通常のDipStarコード表記がARDS準拠に切り替わります。
ただし、マスターコードが必要である仕様はそのままなので注意。
(しかも実装できているのは0,1,2,9,D0,D2のみ)

直感ヒトフデの場合
@ARDS ON + マスターコード
FFFFFFFF 00000001
F200153C E12FFF1E
@上ボタンを押すとスコア99999999
94000130 FF0000BF
020B627C 05F5E0FF
D0000000 00000000

#112899 - WangJang - Thu Dec 21, 2006 10:06 am

Action Replay DS Mode Added
Enable ARDS Mode FFFFFFFF 00000001

(Supported Code Types 0,1,2,9,D0,D2)

Example
@ARDS ON + MasterCode
FFFFFFFF 00000001
F200153C E12FFF1E
@Press up for 99999999
94000130 FF0000BF
020B627C 05F5E0FF
D0000000 00000000

#113226 - gardevor - Sun Dec 24, 2006 6:11 pm

DipStar Ver.061224 opening to the public
Update and substance DipStar after an interval of two months become updates after an interval of three and a half months.
The content of the update is as follows.

It adds and it ..the following function.. corrects it the change of the version mark to the date type.
･Because 5XXXXXXX and the BXXXXXXX code become unnecessary because of the appearance of the DATEL search kit, it removes it.
･Addition of action replay DS code interchangeable mode. Only 0, 1, 2, 5, 9, D0, and the D2 code are mounted.
(When FFFFFFFF 00000001 is described in the first line, switch. )
･The consumption memory is reduced even to the half (improvement of soft operation).
･To specify the file passing after m3dip.exe is started, UI is corrected.
･Hasteds.exe is corrected to correspond to DeSmuME v0.5.0.

Though it doesn't describe in detail because action replay DS interchangeable mode is still an experimentation phase
The code translation is switched by putting FFFFFFFF 00000001 on the first line.
The remodeling code of action replay DS can be used.
However, the mastering code : because it needs the one of DipStar.
Please note that analytical work is needed when an existing code is used.

#113885 - cracker - Sun Dec 31, 2006 7:33 pm

First off, don't say anything about 'ROMS'. We don't want this thread to get shut down.

To use dipstar on an m3:
1. Write dipstar.ds.gba using Write GBA in m3 manager
2. Drop your game onto m3dip.exe and hit enter
3. Write it to the m3 as usual

To enter codes:
1. Highlight dipstar.ds.gba and hit A
2. Hightlight the game and hit A
3. After you verify the save files hold L (continuing to hold it through the GBA splash screen until DipStar shows)
4. Choose a slot to use for your codes and enter them in
5. Hit Start to save the codes and reboot the DS

To play the game with codes:
1. Highlight dipstar.ds.gba and hit A
2. Hightlight the game and hit A
3. After you verify the save files hold the button corresponding to the slot you used to store the codes in (continuing to hold it until the game has begun)

#113896 - Jokersrwild - Sun Dec 31, 2006 8:51 pm

Yeah sorry about that ill make sure not to use the hot words again. As for my question no need anymore. Turns out that Digimon Ds just doesnt work with the version of Dipstar i was using I went back to using 3.33 and the codes are working just fine now. But thanks for the help anyway.

#114256 - gardevor - Fri Jan 05, 2007 9:55 pm

Mariodood wrote:
In that tutorial, it says you need to patch the game by using M3DIS or whatever. I drag the game into there, but I have no idea what to do from there. Pushing enter just closes it.

That's correct. When you drag the file to m3dip, you should see something like 230000>80000, then it closes itself after you push Enter.

Didn't know about the site being down...you can grab all the old versions from the Dipstar Code Library http://www.funtopia.nl/library/dipstar.html
All wifi-capable games need version 3 to run, otherwise you can use the newest version.

#114710 - gardevor - Wed Jan 10, 2007 9:02 am

shark2003 wrote:

Its for the (U) version. I guess that was pure luck,but how I stumbled on it was I was trying to do a comparison with the (E) version disassembly with the (U) disassembly,since there are MP inf codes for the (E) version I looked around the same area (or what I thought may be the same area) in the (U) and found that and a couple other numbers and tried them out.


It would be very easy to find the Code for the (U) version if you've already got the codes for the (E) version. Just use a hex editor and look for the same hex values on both versions, then you should get the correct address for it.

shark2003 wrote:
Lost Magic

Accidently found this one trying to find an infinite magic code,its probably not to far off from this one though. This is kind of weird but the effect seems to be it prevents the enemy sages from casting spells...LOL.

Stop Enemy Sage/Wizard from Casting Spells

0210362C 00000000


I remember how I found this..I did a search in (E) disassembly going off the first pasrt of the AR code for inf MP http://us.codejunkies.com/codes_show.asp?rf=1&c=GB&cr=GBP&cs=?&r=1&l=1&g=17825908&p=18 and dropping the 9
and I found 020BE020,then did a search in the (U) for that and thats when I found 0210362C..???

#115014 - gardevor - Fri Jan 12, 2007 6:03 am

Infinite Health or MP
9210346c
I think u drop the 9 then get the HEX values at the address (E), then search for the same hex values on the (U) version.
in other words....basically (E) codes + 1C0 = (U) codes
0210346c + 1c0 = 0210362c

#115088 - gardevor - Fri Jan 12, 2007 10:49 pm

laurens wrote:
Thanks a lot! I wanted those for a very loonnggg time!
Anyway, i see you made a Advance Time and a Rewind time.
So i was hoping of you could make a Increase and Decrease money code for it.
Like pressing R+up increases your money with 1000 and pressing R+down decreases it with 1000.
Or maybe holding it will slowly increase or decrease your money.


Just replace the Time code address with the GP address
023D6B08. You should be able to do it yourself :)
(R +DOWN ) C1000000 1000027F
(R +UP ) C1000000 100002BF

Note: You won't see the Money value changing when you're displaying the GP screen, click on the other menu then back to see the result.

#115425 - dualscreenman - Tue Jan 16, 2007 1:13 am

No problem. :)

The latest Dipstar has support for some Action Replay codes, I believe.

This WIP AR to/from CB converter might serve to be useful because the standard 8/16/32-bit writes for Codebreaker and Action Replay are the same.

The only hitch is that so far it converts from CB -> AR and porting between the cheat devices entail switching the first number of a code for a different number. (It's easy anyway.)[/url]

When in the game (i know how to store the codes so no probs there) i hold down the select button (where i store them) but when i load a game or start a new one, the codes don't allow me infinite health food water and strength... but at the same time there seems to be no freezing or glitching for the need of any C codes. #119268 - gardevor - Wed Feb 21, 2007 8:37 am

Well, if you were able to get 1 game to work with dipstar, there shouldn't be any problem with other games.

Btw, no dipstar codes will work with any game unless the game is already m3dipped!!!!!!!!! And, not all cards will work in conjunction with R4, maybe that's the case with your EZF II.

#119353 - gardevor - Thu Feb 22, 2007 7:41 am

jalaneme wrote:

i have no idea what to look for but this is what comes up when i drag the file to m3dip.exe


On the "Original ARM7 boot address:" if it's 8000000 (m3dipped), then it'll boot with GBA mode where Dipstar lies.. but, according to the pic, yours is the original address 2300000, then it'll only boot in DS mode without link to gba mode. It's a miracle that you would able to get the RE cheats to work then............

#120107 - dualscreenman - Thu Mar 01, 2007 2:03 am

Now you don't have to use HasteDS to do your searching! While I give props to Imaha for making the only searching tool to date, it is quite limited in search parameters and occasionally hooks games wrong and swaps bytes in searches.

The much more robust Renegade64 searching tool by Viper187 now has No$gba hooking.
Link to official Thread

Direct Download
Download
Enjoy!

#120145 - kittyprincess66 - Thu Mar 01, 2007 9:17 am

Is line 00 in dipstar used for the master code?

EDIT:

Still having issues this is what I have tried so far. Ver3.33 M3Lite

Install

1. Write "dipstar.ds.gba" to the memory card (Using M3game manager).
2. Transfer NDSROM to the memory card (Using M3game manager).
3. Boot M3-Lite.
4. Scroll todipstar from the game menu of M3 and press the A button.
5. Scroll to NDSROM and press the A button.
6. Press the any button with the load screen.

OK, did this it produces white screens of death when game loads but it did load dipstar's dat. file.

So I tried this:

1. Download the DipStar complete package from the M3 / 3rd Party download section
2. Copied dipstar.ds.gba to SD card
3. Copied dipstar.ds.dat from the cheats exchange to subdirectory "GAMESAVE"
4. Drag&drop ROM from the memory card onto m3dip.exe.
5. Put the card into the M3 and turn on the DS
6. Select "dipstar.ds.gba" and press A (nothing will happens just a short blink)
7. Choose the DS game and press A
8. Press A again and _quickly_ press and hold the button for the cheat. Hold the button until the game has loaded.

Any file that is dipped comes back with a stall at loading and black screen at the top.

ALSO: Can anyone point me to a tutorial for writing the cheat.txt file. I need syntax information. Thank you.

#123312 - weltall - Tue Mar 27, 2007 5:44 am

I wanted to ask for some help.

To begin with I am using G6 4G flashcard with G6 Passcard.

I am trying to use dipstar with Pokemon Ranger USA.

1. I am first loading the game in the cartrige through UDisk Manager with soft reset, trim and ofcourse support for loading dipstar.

2. I patch the rom in the cartrige with m3dip

3. I load Dipstar in the cartrige through UDisk manager

4. I load Dipstar in the memory and load pokemon while holding L and I add manually insert these codes

C0000000 02101FF0
F20CC6C8 E12FFF1E
02135500 000000FF

which are the master code and the quick level up in slots 00-02 and I press start reseting (I do it manually cause I am not lucky with txt2dip)

5. I load again Dipstar in the memory and then load Pokemon while holding X. It loads ok but nothing happens.

I have tried this with different dipstar versions but I do not seem able to make it work. Can anyone tell me what I am doing wrong?

#123313 - gardevor - Tue Mar 27, 2007 6:02 am

You don't hold the X button when loading the game. Hold the button where ever the codes are Saved in. If you save it in the Up slot, hold UP when loading the game, if you save in A slot, hold down the A button when loading the game..

#123315 - weltall - Tue Mar 27, 2007 6:21 am

Ahhhhh ><! Thanks and I am really sorry. I didn't saw that. Thanks a million times. I am goint to test it !!! Thanks again X3!!!

-Edit-

Tested and it works great. One last thing I was wondering. Is there a "best version" of dipstar for each game? I am asking because I see some posts saying it needs 3.33 or 3.50. Thanks.

#123356 - arctic_flame - Tue Mar 27, 2007 5:09 pm

On a non wifi game, use the latest dipstar.

All versions apart from 3.33/3.50 have a Wifi-detection feature to prevent online cheating, which is frustrating in games like Castlevania:POR

So, to clarify: No wifi: Latest Dipstar
Has wifi: 3.33/3.50

(There is an exception for FF3 as all you do is send letters)

#123429 - cracker - Wed Mar 28, 2007 2:35 am

For Custom Robo Arena (U) use this MasterCode instead:

C0000000 022E4028
F2071F68 E12FFF1E

The one gardevor posted overwrites some code that will probably cause a crash somewhere along the line, this one uses a blank area of memory.

Last edited by cracker on Sun Apr 01, 2007 3:05 am; edited 1 time in total

#123431 - weltall - Wed Mar 28, 2007 2:41 am

My save just got lost? Today I tried to play Custom Robo without loading the dipstar cheats and when the main screen opened and I pressed story it asked me to input my name!! I tried to load it with dipstar after but still there was no save. Is there such a problem wioth G6 and dipstar. Also I tried this with Pokemon ranger and I got the same error. Does it mean I need to always load dipstar first and then run the game or I will lose my save?

#123432 - cracker - Wed Mar 28, 2007 2:51 am

When you cheat you ALWAYS risk the chance of losing your save. If you are only needing the infinite money and all parts codes then I suggest you put those cheats on and save right away then use the save and not DipStar. This is the safest method but then you won't get the infinite hp in the game.

#123598 - GNU_Raziel - Thu Mar 29, 2007 2:30 pm

With G6 there is also a battery problem, I got it with mine, the battery is dead, so the device don't save anymore.
The save stay in SRAM until you turn off you NDS.

You can still save by doing a Software Reset before turning off your NDS (not supported by all games).

Hope this will help you.
_________________
Software Is Like Sex, It's Better When It's Free

@Invincible
122CB1CC 0000FF00

This was a pain in the ass to find! :)

#123804 - cracker - Sat Mar 31, 2007 7:43 am

I just wanted to let other DipStar hackers out there know about some methods I have found for finding alternative types of hooks (Mastercodes).

04000110 - timer register -- This will many times lead to a good place to hook. This is a good place to start if you have exhausted your search for 04000130 (key register) based hooks.

04000136 - key xy input -- This will sometimes get you a good place to hook if 4000130 cannot be found.

040001c0 & 040001c2 - R/W control registers -- They always go together and will sometimes yield good places to hook. They also are found along with 04000136 in a few spots in most games.

#132861 - tepples - Sat Jun 30, 2007 5:54 pm

In Tetris DS, some inexperienced players use the "starman" cheat, which gives a player all I tetrominoes. Some of my friends on the tetrisconcept.com board routinely beat "starman" cheaters with better efficient at stacking. Likewise, in Mario Kart DS, you can often beat cheaters without using cheats yourself by snaking the crap out of them.

Brothers in Arms doesn't have a soundtrack by DS, does it?

Luminous Arc (U) Dipstar Codes

Mastercode
C0000000 023B9420
F2068CC8 E12FFF1E


Max Money
22157490 0098967F

All Characters MAX Status
02097B6B 000000E5

Instant Victory (Enemy HP 0)
121597A0 00000000
12159846 00000000
121598EC 00000000
12159992 00000000
12159A38 00000000
12159ADE 00000000
12159B84 00000000
12159C2A 00000000

Inventory Modifier
Slot 1
221575EC 006300xx

Slot 2
221575F4 006300xx

Slot 3
221575FC 006300xx

Slot 4
22157604 006300xx

Add hEX +8 to address for the next Slot

xx =
01 = VitaMint
02 = ViTonic
03 = Vita-Max
04 = MagiMint
05 = MagiSoda
06 = Magi-Max
07 = FP-Fizzy

Feel free to update the Inventory List...

#141179 - gardevor - Sun Sep 23, 2007 12:18 am

Here's an example on how to convert CB codes to Dipstar codes

if the CB codes starts with 0, 1 , 2 then they're exactly the same on Dipstar

if it starts with a 4, try this (some codes might not work the way it intended to)

MAX HP for Dawn:

CB..................................................................> Dipstar
42135A8C 00280059.....................> 42135A8C 0000270F
0000270F 00000000 .....................> 20000028 00000059
42135A90 00280059 .....................> 42135A90 0000270F
0000270F 00000000 ......................> 20000028 00000059

CB Code Type
4XXXXXXX TWWWZZZZ
YYYYYYYY VVVVVVVV

XXXXXXX = Address
T = Bit-type Write, 0 for 32-Bit, 1 for 16-Bit & 2 for 8-Bit
WWW = Number of times to repeat
ZZZZ = Increase Address by
YYYYYYYY = Start Value
VVVVVVVV = Increase Value by


Dipstar Code Type
4XXXXXXX YYYYYYYY .. Repert write
W000ZZZZ UUUUUUUU

XXXXXXX= Address
YYYYYYYY = Start Value
W = (0=8bit write / 1=16bit write / 2=32bit write)
ZZZZ = Number of times to repeat
UUUUUUUU = Increase Address by

CB Codes credits to Hiei_YYH.

#141208 - samsung - Sun Sep 23, 2007 5:19 am

i'm good with those but the ones with the letters are the hardest lmao

Btw, did you find a working m code? or a c code?

#141212 - gardevor - Sun Sep 23, 2007 6:08 am

use ndsmas to find the mastercode..use the one at the bottom
it's the same one for both games and no c code is needed I believe.

#141260 - samsung - Sun Sep 23, 2007 4:47 pm

thanks.

using your format can i translated codes that start with alphabets?

#141276 - gardevor - Sun Sep 23, 2007 7:18 pm

That method only convert codes that starts with 4xxxxxxx which is a shorter version of a long list of codes that starts with 0 or 1 or 2..made way shorter!!!

#142283 - gardevor - Sun Oct 07, 2007 7:18 pm

If the game blacks out when enter or exit a dungeon, the problem could be your c code.
try C0000000 02312D20

and dont use the Gem codes until u have to, someone said the x99 gems have no effects when ugrading (I haven't got that far into the game yet to test), lower it to x20 solves the problem.
20=14hex

UPDATE:
If you used the Gem codes x99 and saved game. The next time, you play the game without those codes and after getting a new gem will cause the game to black out when you enter the Collection Menu, guess you can't go over 100 (This also occurs to the Hourglass Code). You'll will have to re-enable those codes to get the Collection Menu working again. or Lower the value in the codes.

Last edited by gardevor on Mon Oct 15, 2007 12:35 am; edited 4 times in total

#142586 - shark2003 - Wed Oct 10, 2007 4:52 pm

Fixed my C code and changed my Gem codes and havent had the game lock up on me yet,so it seems to be working. I tried the Salvage Arm HP code and the Gost Ship invisible/invincible codes but they dont seem to be working. Are there any Inf Arrow or 99 Arrow codes yet?

#142596 - gardevor - Wed Oct 10, 2007 6:29 pm

shark2003 wrote:
Fixed my C code and changed my Gem codes and havent had the game lock up on me yet,so it seems to be working. I tried the Salvage Arm HP code and the Gost Ship invisible/invincible codes but they dont seem to be working. Are there any Inf Arrow or 99 Arrow codes yet?


That's probably because the Mastercode you are using don't work with certain codes :)

999 Arrows
121BA590 0000F000
121BA682 000003E7

999 Bombchus
121BA598 00001000
121BA686 000003E7

If the Mastercode you are using, gives you INF Rupees, Bombs, etc.. meaning the amount won't deduct when you use it. Then that Mastercode should work with all codes.

#143601 - chishm - Wed Oct 24, 2007 10:25 am

tepples wrote:
Could Nintendo thwart DipStar and AR by introducing address space layout randomization?

Not really. The program has to keep track of the addresses using pointers, and AR has a pointer following code.

#143767 - gardevor - Thu Oct 25, 2007 10:10 pm

After you used the Power Up, just enter the command again to regain the power up... or use the cycle thur power ups code posted by cracker a while back..in the page 30s or 40s of this thread

and with the Codejunkies All Coins/Finished Levels code, I think you still need to beat a level first b4 can going to the next level
ex. beat 1-1 in order to go to 1-2

#143810 - gardevor - Fri Oct 26, 2007 7:58 am

Here's the link to cracker's post http://forum.gbadev.org/viewtopic.php?p=109593#109593
But, it'll freeze the game if pess L when you have no power up in the Power Up Slot. change the code that ended with 01 to 00 will fix the problem.

To convert the Codjunkies All Coins code, you can use the ar > dipstar method
0>2

or here's a shorter version of the code
42088C4C D7D7D7D7
2000002F 00000004

#143899 - shark2003 - Sat Oct 27, 2007 5:33 am

or here's a shorter version of the code
42088C4C D7D7D7D7

Since, different Monsters appear differently in Day time and in Night time
Here's a code I hacked that switches time:

Push Select and UP for Day Time
E4000130 100003BB
1218EE3C 00006970

Push Select and Down for Night Time
E4000130 1000037B
1218EE3C 00003CA0

Here are more codes I made:

Game thinks that Mileena, Ermac, Classic Sub-Zero has been unlocked:
Mileena Playable
0225168C 00000001

Ermac Playable
0225168E 00000001

Classic Sub-Zero Playable
02251690 00000001

Start at Shao Kahn Codes:
Beginner
022516AC 00000007
Warrior
022516AC 00000008
Master(2nd from the right)
022516AC 00000009
Master(1st from the right)
022516AC 0000000A

Note: These codes actually skips to and always start at the level the value states. If you used the Beginner code, and you play the Warrior mode, you'll always fight Kintaro. You can add a Joker command to it to skip to the # of level you want at any time.

Always Play As regardless of whom you choose
0225138C 000000xx
00- Kano to
15 - Classic Sub-zero

Always Play in the same (stage) background, except when fight Boss
0225169C 000000xx

Don't know the Stage Names, so can't complete the list
05 - Windy Street
17 - Portal

Random Battles (Not fight the same character shown in the pic of the Tower)
022516A8 00000000

CPU Can't Walk (Stays at the same spot)
2225150C 00000000

No Blocking
022517C4 00000001

No Energy Bar Displays, fight on full screen
12251674 00000000

Access to Extras > Lost Treasures without Unlocking them
022516E2 000000xx

01 - Fight Noob Saibot
02 - Fight Ermac
03 - Fight Ermac and Noob Saibot
04 - Fight Classic Sub-Zero and Human Smoke
05 - Fight Noob Saibot, Ermac, Smoke, Classic Sub-Zero, and Mileena
06 - View Fatality Demo 1
07 - View Fatality Demo 2
08 - View Fatality Demo 3
09 - View Supreme Demostration (All Fatalities, Babalities, Friendships, Animalities)
0A - 20 Endings (Kano - Human Smoke)


Play As Human Smoke (Press L+R) right after you choose any character
E4000130 100000FF
0225138C 00000016

Infinite Fatality Time (Select+UP=ON, Select+Down=OFF)
E2251518 00000001
022526D8 00000080
E4000130 100003FB
02251518 00000001
E4000130 1000037B
02251518 00000000

Note: ON, anytime during the round..OFF after pull off Fatality
otherwise it'll skip Showing and Pronoucing "Fatality, Friendship, etc...), and must be OFF after Shao Kahn is defeated.

Play As Noob Saibot (Press L+R) right after you choose any Tower
E4000130 100000FF
0225138C 00000017

Combo Practice (or VS. Mode) by using these 2 codes
12251508 000000xx <-Enter Vs. Mode
02251510 000000A6 <--Inf HP for Player 2

xx =
00 = Kano, 01 = Sonya, 02 = Jax, 03 = Night Wolf, 04 = Sub Zero, 05 = Stryker, 06 = Sindel, 07 = Sektor, 08 =Cryax, 09 = Kung Lao, 0A = Kabal, 0B = Sheeva, 0C = Shang Tsung, 0D = Liu Kang, 0E = Robo Smoke, 0F = Kitana, 10 = Jade, 11 = Mileena, 12 = Scorpion, 13 = Reptile , 14 = Ermac, 15 = Classic Sub-Zero, 16 = Human Smoke, 17 = Noob Saibot, 18 = Motaro, 19 = Shao Kahn

#147785 - gardevor - Thu Dec 27, 2007 10:16 pm

I guess not that many people still uses Dipstar. But, here are a few Mastercodes in case some people still need it:

Contra 4 (U)
C0000000 0220F1F0
F215952C E12FFF1E

Dragon Quest 4 (J)
F20771E8 E12FFF1E
Experience Points x64 after Battle
E212457E 00003008
22124580 01806CC0


Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3 (U) (Not Puzzle Kombat)
C0000000 02100000
F20AA8BC E12FFF1E

Final Fantasy 4 (J)
C0000000 0215F000
F2004024 E12FFF1E

Note: Most of the FF4 Codes (GP, EXP, Items, etc...) must be used with Conditional or Joker Commands, otherwise you'll get a corrupt save file.

02034130 E3A01002
02034134 E1C015BC


I have a question...If the values for the code are all 32bit (xx=8bit, xxxx=16bit, xxxxxxxx=32bit), then how come the 1st and 4th line are 16bit while all other lines are 8bit? 0=8bit, 1=16bit, 2=32bit on Dipstar

#148696 - shark2003 - Wed Jan 09, 2008 12:16 am

gardevor wrote:
shark2003 wrote:


Never Mind,I figured it out myself. Here it is.


Contra 4

Invincible:
1202DCC8 E1D405BC
0202DCCC E3A00002
0202DCD0 E1C405BC
1203412C E1D015BC
02034130 E3A01002
02034134 E1C015BC


I have a question...If the values for the code are all 32bit (xx=8bit, xxxx=16bit, xxxxxxxx=32bit), then how come the 1st and 4th line are 16bit while all other lines are 8bit? 0=8bit, 1=16bit, 2=32bit on Dipstar

2202DCCC E3A00002
2202DCD0 E1C405BC
22034130 E3A01002
22034134 E1C015BC

#148716 - gardevor - Wed Jan 09, 2008 7:24 am

D2000000 00000000

Oic..Actually AR codes that starts with a 5 , I think is a condition code, like when the value at address 0202DCC8 is E1D4058C, then change the value at address 0202DCCC to E1C405BC....sometimes it's Ok to leave out that line

#148741 - dualscreenman - Wed Jan 09, 2008 6:24 pm

That condition is checking for some ASM, so the conditional code is probably checking to see whether you actually are in game or not. Leaving this out would probably be ok, but there's also a chance that strange things could happen.
_________________

#150639 - dexter0 - Sat Feb 09, 2008 1:52 am

I am assuming your trying to use this code with dipstar syntax. Your main problem is that the syntax for this code is in ARDS form, not dipstar. Another option for you is Nitro HAX by chism.

Check out the Nitro HAX page on kodewerx:
http://kodewerx.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=894

You will need to register to view it.

0223A0BD 00000027

999 HP/MP/Attack/Defense/Agility/Wisdom (1st Character)
420B3E0C 03E703E7
20000004 00000004

+194 hEX for the next character
ex. 2nd character
420B3FA0 xxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx

Infinite Item Usage
021E86B8 00000014

Since, different Monsters appear differently in Day time and in Night time
Here's a code I hacked that switches time:

Push Select and UP for Day Time
E4000130 100003BB
1218EE3C 00006970

Push Select and Down for Night Time
E4000130 1000037B
1218EE3C 00003CA0

22069E58 0000D047

Mastercode
C0000000 02177000

Invincible and Inf SP
020FB6C1 00000005

Max Attack
0212f1ec 000003e7

Max DEF
0212f1ee 000003e7

Max MAGic
0212f1f0 000003e7

Quick Level Up (Save Game After Reaching level 99 and Reboot without code activated,do this everytime a new character joins your party)
22069E58 0000D047
02069E5A 00008929
24000130 02400004
02069E5A 00001C01

Max Attack
1212f1ec 000003e7

Max DEF
1212f1ee 000003e7

Max MAGic
1212f1f0 000003e7

#153601 - gardevor - Wed Apr 02, 2008 7:26 pm

That's kinda strange, no code works for me when I use just C0000000 02177000 without a Mastercode. Are you sure you didn't use 1 of the Mastercodes from ndsmas?? I remember 1 of them works.

There were some people on other forums complaining about the Gil code not working too. Maybe the address is not fixed, I couldn't test it cuz I lost my savefile already. But, it should work at the start of the game.

Anyways these is what I use:

Dipstar 3.x is required

Mastercode
C0000000 023B2120
F2011148 E12FFF1E

or
C0000000 023B2120
F20129B0 E12FFF1E

only tested with codes: GP, HP, SP, STATS

Update: Save the Game without the Inf GP code, then reload the Save with Inf GP code. It works fine.

I believe those are posted by cracker in gbatemp, but he already mentioned that he didn't test them. So, it's normal if those didn't work.

Sometimes, it's definitely hard on finding a good working mastercode. And even if you thought you've found a mastercode in the first place, how do heck do you know if a C code is needed?
Guess no one have a 100% way of finding a goiod Mastercode, that's why there's no real tutorial on it and sometimes, it requires alot of testing when trying to find those....

I didn't post those 2 Mastercodes anywhere else that's why you didn't see them on other sites. But 1 of the 2 is from ndsmas F20129B0 E12FFF1E, all you need is a working C code, those should work fine on some codes if not all.

#153807 - gardevor - Sun Apr 06, 2008 8:04 pm

Here's another tip on find mastercodes. If the ones from ndsmas doesn't work. Search for those in the *.txt file that you created from ndsdis then try a few E12FFF1E above or below those. Sometime it'll work.
This game uses wifi for multiplayer, so it can't be use on Dipstar 5.x. As the Moon Jump, try this:

Push B for Moon Jump
E2030A96 000000028
22030A98 1C291B8A
E4000130 100003FD
22030A98 FAC8F7CF
2200002C 1C294A01
22000030 FD34F030
22000034 00003AA8

#153812 - shark2003 - Sun Apr 06, 2008 9:18 pm

This game uses wifi for multiplayer, so it can't be use on Dipstar 5.x. As the Moon Jump, try this:

Push B for Moon Jump
E2030A96 000000028
22030A98 1C291B8A
E4000130 100003FD
22030A98 FAC8F7CF

#159523 - cracker - Wed Jul 02, 2008 10:04 am

I don't mean to jack the thread but I don't think there's much harm now since DipStar seems to be kind of defunct. I have made a program called DSATM (DS Auto Trainer Maker) that can be used as an alternative to DipStar. It patches the cheat function into the game. There is no need for mastercodes and games can usually be patched automatically without changing any settings. Check it out here.

#160064 - shark2003 - Wed Jul 09, 2008 11:12 pm

cracker wrote:
I don't mean to jack the thread but I don't think there's much harm now since DipStar seems to be kind of defunct. I have made a program called DSATM (DS Auto Trainer Maker) that can be used as an alternative to DipStar. It patches the cheat function into the game. There is no need for mastercodes and games can usually be patched automatically without changing any settings. Check it out here.
